content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

Here is an implementation of your request in Julia:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Extract all code blocks, remove code fences and join them together with newline
    blocks = collect(eachmatch(r"```julia\n(.*?)\n```", md, seperator=SubString)) do match
        trim(match[1])
    end
    return join([block.match for block in blocks], "\n")
end
```

This function works by using a regular expression to find code fenced sections of the markdown file. It extracts these and removes the surrounding backticks (`), then trims any leading or trailing white space from each block. The trimmed blocks are then joined together with newline characters.

Please note that it will only capture Julia code blocks surrounded by ```julia\n (without spaces) at start and end of block, not python code blocks with Python3 or other languages. If you want to extract all code blocks regardless the language used, you need to adjust the regular expression accordingly.
